item.title: Large tech companies don't need heroes
item.description: Large tech companies operate via systems. What that means is that the main outcomes - up to and including the overall success or failure of the company - are driven by a complex network of processes and incentives. These systems are outside the control of any particular person. Like the parts of a large codebase, they have accumulated and co-evolved over time, instead of being designed from scratch.

Tools I had yet to fully integrate into how I write software. If you know the Star Trek episode The Doomsday Machine -- where Kirk…

item.title: Your Best Thinking Is Wasted on the Wrong Decisions - Ian Duncan
item.description: Some engineering decisions punish you for being wrong. Most don't. Learning to tell the difference and calibrate your deliberation accordingly might be the most valuable skill your team never explicitly develops.

item.title: I built a terminal monitoring app and custom firmware for a desktop clock with Claude
item.description: The way that I've used AI for coding has changed drastically over the last year. In fact, the rate at which it is changing is probably the most drastic element of it – I can't recall any time since my first year of college, twenty years ago, that I've experienced such a rapid evolution in my own ability to do stuff. This week I have written a fully self-contained system monitoring daemon and terminal UI, as well as custom Rust firmware for the Ulanzi TC001 desktop clock. These are two projects that would have remained ideas, never making it out of my notes folder.

item.title: How I squeezed a BERT sentiment analyzer into 1GB RAM on a $5 VPS
item.description: How to fit a transformer model into a low-memory VPS using Dynamic Quantization and ONNX Runtime.

item.description: La Suite numérique is a set of open-source applications for digital collaboration and teamwork. It offers modern solutions for the digital workplace. - La Suite numérique

item.title: Exploring a Modern SMTPE 2110 Broadcast Truck With My Dad
item.description: In October, my Dad and I got to go behind the scenes at two St. Louis Blues (NHL hockey) games, and observe the massive team effort involved in putting together a modern digital sports broadcast. I wanted to explore the timing and digital side of a modern SMPTE 2110 mobile unit, and my Dad has been involved in studio and live broadcast for decades, so he enjoyed the experience as the engineer not on duty!
